text: Feature request: When I blow away an agency team member Partner account, I should be able to delete every instance of that user in all of the client hubs as well. It’s silly to have to do this in dozens of hubs one at a time.
Agree, I usually add a custom field to manage it
<@U43TQ13HD> I have had clients delete my account accidentally and reset my password before. I'm not sure I would want them to have power to completely delete me from all portals
<@U38EZFVFE> No, not them. If I remove an agency staff member from OUR hub, I should have the option to remove them from all associated parter portals.
I would say yeah as long as the email that the login is associated with is the same domain as your partner admins is
the last one in the list doesnt always mean its the first one though :disappointed:
Do you simply rely on people entering the correct tag or do you pull a tag list for a choice field?
General idea - start a bug bounty program
I believe we have one. I don't know the details, but check out this page: <https://bugcrowd.com/HubSpot>

similar, it’s a security vulnerability one. Which I still have one exploit I could submit to it. - but I was thinking one more for bugs themselves. I feel like I find a lot of bugs - not at all saying your software isn’t top-notch, it definitely is, I just tend to find a lot of very odd bugs that only happen if the right conditions occur kinda thing.

for example I just found a scary one. I staged a copy of a sites homepage. edited up the page a bunch, kept saving throughout(haven’t published to staging yet) did refresh the screen. went to publish and discovered the staged page was no longer in staging but in the website pages. fortunately I didn’t publish or it  possibly could have overwritten the homepage.

I went into content staging  and my staged version of the homepage is there stating the last time I edited it was when I first created the staged page, and the page I was working on is now in the website pages as a draft. It’s a separate page from the homepage page fortunately.

So I don’t know what happened other than something maybe screwed up when I refreshed prior to publishing but that is kind of a terrifying thing

I usually hardcode the list because most of the projects have a small list of "primary" topics to handle.
But if you need a choice field with all of them you can generate it with the blog_topics('default', 250) function
